question: Who can enroll the customer?
answer: Retail FR (FRR) can enroll to BRO Customers. UKU FR (FRW) can enroll to UKU Mechanics. JMR can enroll to Bosch Extra mechanics. SWS BP can enroll to NW customers.

question: Which type of customers can be enrolled from Mobile application?
answer: The type of customers that can be enrolled via Mobile App: Retailer, Car Garage, CV Garage, NW, IW, UKU, Bosch Extra Mechanic.

question: What are the conditions applicable in Enrollment?
answer: 1. Same Mobile No. cannot be enrolled with the same BMD Channel if one UID already is in Active status. 2. Blocked by HO customers are not considered for enrollment. 3. Retailer can be enrolled with any type of BMD like BMD SAC, BMD CV, BMD PC, RBIC, BBD. 4. CV Garage, NW, UKU Mechanic can be enrolled under BMD SAC & BMD CV. 5. Car Garage, IW, Bosch Extra Mechanic can be enrolled under BMD PC. 6. Authorized Workshop flow from eFocus, or Area Manager can send details in defined format to techsupport.

question: How Enrollment cycle works_BRO Customer?
answer: 1. FR/BP SWS BP Logins to Bosch Infocom Mobile Application. 2. Submit Enrollment with all Necessary details. 3. BMD Login to Mobile Application and approve the enrollment (Cust Code Generated). 4. BMD upload the NEFT details - If NEFT already submitted for same Mobile No. then same will be auto clubbed. 5. Area Manager will approve the Enrollment. 6. Agency will verify the enrollment. 7. Channel Manager will approve the enrollment.

question: How Enrollment cycle works_UKU Mechanic?
answer: 1. FR - UKU Logins to Bosch Infocom Mobile Application. 2. Submit Enrollment with all Necessary details. 3. BMD Login to Mobile Application and approve the enrollment (Cust Code Generated). 4. Zonal Manager will approve the Enrollment.

question: How Enrollment cycle works_Bosch Extra Mechanic Mechanic?
answer: 1. JMR Logins to Bosch Infocom Mobile Application. 2. Submit Enrollment with all Necessary details. 3. JM Login to Mobile Application and approve the enrollment. 4. Channel Manager will approve the Enrollment.

question: What is the process of Copy Customer?
answer: 1. Copy customer option applicable for all unauthorised customers. 2. FR will login to Mobile app and enter the Mobile No. which is already enrolled in Programmed. 3. Block customer cannot copy by entering Mobile No. 4. Customer can copy with same Customer channel. 5. Same Mobile No. cannot be copied in same BMD Channel as One BMD Channel = one UID. 6. All Information will Copy other than Geo Code. 7. Approval process will remain same as per New enrollment.

question: Where can I find the current Enrollment Status?
answer: 1. User can refer the Single Customer Information Report available under Master Menu.

question: How Geo Verification process work?
answer: 1. Geo Verification can be done by any application user (FR to HO). 2. Geo Verification Process application for Existing Enrolled Customer, Authorised Customer flow from eFocus & Not already available with 8 Digit SAP Code. 3. After Geo Verification, NEFT Submission, AM Approval, Agency Verification & Channel Manager Approval (Other than Authorised Customers) is mandatory for any transactions like Order, Incentive Calculation etc.

question: What is the Process for Geo Modification?
answer: 1. Geo Request can be sent by FR or BP during Mark Visit or Order Submission (Cumulative Order Value > 20K). If any Incentive not paid for customer - AM has to approve the Geo Modification request from customer location. 2. If Incentive Already Paid for Customer then BP/AM/ZM has to do the Mark Visit from Failure Location and share the Location to techsupport@pearlcomp.com with HO approval. Technical Support team will update the same from backend.

question: Is NEFT mandatory for Payout?
answer: Yes, NEFT is mandatory during New Enrollment or Geo Verification for AM Approval as in 2020 policy only NEFT is payout mode.

question: Who can submit the NEFT details?
answer: BMD can submit the NEFT details via Web Portal or any user from FR to User can submit the same from Mobile Application.

question: Which documents are mandatory for NEFT details?
answer: Cancel Cheque and Consent Form with Seal or Sign is mandatory for NEFT submission (If Name is not imprinted on cancel cheque then Passbook copy to be submitted for Beneficiary verification).

question: Unable to submit NEFT - Getting message - Account already exists.
answer: If user is getting message 'NEFT already submitted', it means Same account No. already exists in system. If user wants to remove from system and wants to update against new Mobile No., then Channel Manager Approval is required.

question: What are possibilities for NEFT rejection?
answer: 1. NEFT will be submitted by User. 2. Agency will approve the NEFT. 3. NEFT cross verify by CTG when 1st time payout is doing on same Account No.

question: What are possibilities for NEFT rejection?
answer: 1. Cancel Cheque, Consent Form or Cancel Cheque with Passbook Copy if Name is not imprinted is not attached. 2. Attachments are not clearly visible - Agency unable to recognize the details. 3. Consent Form not fulfilled by user properly - UID, Mobile No, Seal or Sign (any one) is missing on consent form. 4. Incorrect data entry during NEFT submission.

question: Is any communication received by anyone if NEFT is rejected by Agency?
answer: Yes, if NEFT is rejected by Agency, an auto-trigger mail is sent to respective BMD & Area Manager with reason.

question: Where can I know the NEFT rejection reason if other than mail?
answer: On rewards portal, BMD can know the reason for NEFT rejection as per Account type selection.

question: Who can create the Order?
answer: Order can be created by any application user (FR to HO).

question: Customer Not Eligible for Order.
answer: As per policy, customer should be approved by channel Manager. Please check the enrollment status by referring to single customer information.

question: What are the Mandatory conditions for Order creation?
answer:
1. Enrollment Status: Customer should be approved by Channel Manager.
2. Shop Registration Copy: If Cumulative order value for the month is > 50K
3. GSTN: If Cumulative order value for the month is > 1 Lac.

question: How Order logic works?
answer: Order to be collected on 13-digit part No., however, supply for calculation is on 10 digits.

question: Is GSTN mandatory for Order?
answer: Yes, GSTN is mandatory if Cumulative order value for the month is > 1 Lac.

question: What is the meaning of Auto Order?
answer:
Auto Order is generated by the system after completion of the month in case of BRO and after completion of Quarter in case of Hi10. The system generates the Order for eligible Parts if conditions are fulfilled by customers as below:
1. Minimum 1 Mark visit by linked FR in Month (in case of BRO) and in Quarter (in case of Hi10).
2. Shop Registration copy is mandatory in case cumulative order value (Including Auto Order) is greater than 50K.
3. GSTN is mandatory in case cumulative order value (Including Auto Order) is greater than 1 Lac.
4. Enrollment status should be approved by Channel Manager.

question: Who can submit the Auto Order and in what period?
answer: Auto Order can be submitted by the respective BMD from Portal. The order can be submitted within 5 days after the secondary closing date.

question: Who can submit the Mark Visit?
answer: Mark visit can be submitted by any application user from FR to HO.

question: Can we submit the Mark visit for Non-Registered customers?
answer: Yes, the user can submit the Mark visit details for Non-Registered customers by using the option 'Non-Registered customer mark visit.'

question: What is meant by Failure Mark Visit?
answer: If a difference is identified by the application between customer latitude/Longitude and Visitor latitude/Longitude, then the visit will be considered a failure mark visit.

question: Where can I find the Mark visit details?
answer: On the rewards portal, users can log in and download the Mark visit summary by following the path: MIS Report >> Mark Visit >> Consolidated Mark Visit Summary.

question: What is the minimum condition for a Mark visit?
answer: Customer should be Geo-verified for Mark Visit.

question: How does the Mark Visit module work?
answer:
1. Mark visit can be done by any application user.
2. FR/BP/AM/ZM can do the mark visit to any customer belonging to their zone.
3. NSM can do the mark visit to any customer belonging to their Region.
4. HO user can do the mark visit to any customer in all regions.

question: What is the Logic for Incentive Calculation?
answer: Lesser Qty*LP2 from Order and supply will be considered for Incentive calculation. Incentive is calculated on LP2 and for eligible Parts only.

question: Which type of customers are eligible for BRO?
answer: Retailer, Car Garage, CV Garage, NW, IW, BDS.

question: What is the Logic of Special Customers?
answer: Customer should be approved by Head Office for Special customer consideration.

question: How will the customer get incentive payment?
answer: Incentive is paid via NEFT only. NEFT should be approved by the agency.

question: Where can I get the earned Incentive and payment details?
answer: User can refer to the Single Customer passbook Report available under the Payout Menu.

question: Who can scan the coupon?
answer: Coupon can be scanned by Mechanics/Retailers/FRs/BPs.

question: Which are the options available for coupon scanning?
answer: Via Mobile App by Customer/Mechanic/FRs/BPs.

question: What is the format for scanning the coupon via SMS?
answer: Please refer to the system for SMS scanning format.

question: How can a mechanic know their points?
answer: By logging into the Bosch infocomp Mobile Application.

question: How can a Non-Registered Mechanic/Customer redeem the coupon?
answer: Non-Registered Mechanic/Retailer can get in touch with the nearest Distributor for enrollment.

question: Who can raise the Gift Redemption request?
answer: FRW or BDS can raise the Gift redemption request on behalf of the mechanic.

question: What is the eligibility for Gift Redemption?
answer: Mechanic should have a minimum of 800+ balance points in their account to request redemption.

question: How does the Redemption cycle work?
answer:
1. BDS/UKU-FR can raise the request for redemption via Bosch Infocomp Mobile App.
2. Zonal Manager will approve the request.
3. HO will approve the request after it is approved by ZM.
4. BMD will accept the claim and upload handover photo, invoice copy, and acknowledgment letter (in case of claim raised by UKU FR).
5. UKU BMD will accept the claim, and BDS will upload the handover photos.
6. Agency will verify the gift receipt with the mechanic.
7. CTG will issue the Credit Note to BMD.

question: Where can I track the UKU Points or claim details?
answer: User can log into the rewards portal and track the points and claims in the UKU Passbook option available under the UKU Menu.

question: How can we change the customer name or shop name?
answer: BMD/FR/BP/AM can send an email to Techsupport@pearlcomp.com along with Zonal Manager approval.

question: How can GSTN be updated?
answer: GSTN can be updated during New Enrollment, Geo Verification, or by BMD login if the customer is already Geo Verified or enrolled from the Utility menu.

question: How can I update the Shop Registration Copy?
answer: Shop Registration can be updated during New Enrollment, Geo Verification, or by BMD login if the customer is already Geo Verified or enrolled from the Utility menu.

question: If GSTN is already updated, is the Shop Registration Copy still required?
answer: No, if GSTN is already updated, the Shop Registration Copy is not required.

question: How can the GSTN be waived off for a customer?
answer: Only NW can avail the benefit for GSTN Waive off logic. This benefit applies only for Incentive calculation, not for Payout.

question: How can I change the Mobile No. of the customer?
answer: BMD/FR/BP/AM can send an email to Techsupport@pearlcomp.com along with Channel Manager approval.

question: Where can user check the NEFT / Enrollment status?
answer:
On Rewards Portal:
For Single customer, user can refer to the Single Customer Information option available in the Master Menu.
For Multiple customers, user can refer to the Secondary Customer Master option available under the Master Menu.
In Mobile Application:
User can refer to Single Customer Information available under the main menu.

question: Where can user check the Customer-wise Turnover?
answer:
User can refer to the Customer-wise Secondary Turnover system path:
MIS Report >> Turnover Report >> Customer-wise Secondary Turnover
For Part-wise data:
MIS Report >> Turnover Report >> Data Sales by BMD

question: Where can we check BRO Eligible customers?
answer:
User can refer to the BRO Monthly Incentive Report by referring to the path:
MIS Report >> Incentive 2020 >> BRO Incentive 2020 >> BRO Monthly Incentive 2020 (by selecting Incentive Amount >0).
MIS Report >> BRO >> BMD BRO Dashboard

question: Is there any provision to check the Part-wise Order Vs. Supply?
answer:
User can refer to the Submitted Offer Order Settlement Report by referring to the path:
MIS Report >> BRO >> Submitted Offer Order Settlement
